entries.title: Technical
writeup: List of Lists is a small Javascript application for the presentation of lists.
Check out the GitHub repository [1] for the source code.
note: LoL is licensed under the MIT license.

entries.title: Hello, lists!
writeup: Lists are defined in JSON, and the format is likely to change at this early stage. Check out doc.json [1] for the JSON file defining this page. Leave "relative_path" set to false as it is used for internal lists. All fields are optional: empty fields are not rendered.
The layout requires flexbox support (latest Firefox or Chrome) and uses @media queries (responsive – resize your browser window!).
If the writeup is an array it is treated as a collection of paragraphs, as seen in this entry.
Navigation links at the top of the page (Home, Docs) are defined in nav_links.json, with a default fallback nav_links.default.json. [2]
A sample photo album stylesheet [3] can be used by pointing the injected style path to it.

entries.label: β
entries.title: Saturn V
entries.subtitle: Crewed LEO and Lunar launch vehicle
entries.writeup: The Saturn V (pronounced "Saturn Five") was an American human-rated expendable rocket used by NASA's Apollo and Skylab programs from 1967 until 1973. A multistage liquid-fueled launch vehicle, NASA launched 13 Saturn Vs from the Kennedy Space Center, Florida with no loss of crew or payload. It remains the tallest, heaviest, and most powerful rocket ever brought to operational status and still holds the record for heaviest payload launched and heaviest payload capacity to Low Earth orbit (LEO).

entries.title: Look at this tiger
entries.subtitle: それは虎だ
entries.writeup: The tiger (Panthera tigris) is the largest cat species, reaching a total body length of up to 3.3 m (11 ft) and weighing up to 306 kg (675 lb). Its most recognizable feature is a pattern of dark vertical stripes on reddish-orange fur with a lighter underside. It has exceptionally stout teeth, and the canines are the longest among living felids with a crown height of as much as 74.5 mm (2.93 in) or even 90 mm (3.5 in).[4] In zoos, tigers have lived for 20 to 26 years, which also seems to be their longevity in the wild.[5] They are territorial and generally solitary but social animals, often requiring large contiguous areas of habitat that support their prey requirements. This, coupled with the fact that they are indigenous to some of the more densely populated places on Earth, has caused significant conflicts with humans.
note: There is no formatting (Panthera tigris should be italic) defined, and that this is an array of strings
which are joined by commas. The note label is defined in the top-level attribute "note_label".
Custom CSS can be injected by adding the path to the CSS file to the top-level 'css' key.
